column2: Indikator BHS
column3: Indicator English

column3: Children of all ethnicities go to school together

column2: Mir dugo traje, pa su ljudi zaboravili na rat.
column3: It has been peace for a long time, so people have forgotten about the war

column3: The separation of people on a national basis brings tears to the eyes of the man from Podhum.

column3: Parents in Podhum don't forbid their children to play with "the others"

column3: "Newcomers" in Podhum do not look ugly when a lady who is dressed according to her faith (with a headscarf)

column3: There is a school football tournament every year organized by nine graders

column3: The cars parked at DUM are not being pushed into Radobolja

column3: A Bosniak child living in Podhum is not ignored by other non-Bosniak children

column3: A Bosniak, who had been in the trenches for four years, can normally communicate with a Croat (a disabled war veteran)

column3: A nun can walk around any part of the city.

column3: Not to think that someone might tell us something uncomfortable in any part of the city

column3: We don't think that someone will attack us in whatever part of the city

column3: From kindergarten years on, children are not taught that different nationality children are against them.

column3: The city organizes events where children can play together in real life

column3: The Imam from Podhum felt comfortable at the opening of the Catholic church in Mostar

column3: A person's name is not important, but rather his/her value as a human

column3: Going out not only means a club, but also a walk with friends

column2: Kada ljudi, ako im je potreban novac, pitaju
column3: When people, if money is of importance to them, ask for it.

column3: When people, if they need money, ask for it rather than robbing.

column3: When sports fans have more obligations (such as a job, family, school) than sitting around, having coffee and planning riots

column3: When there is no fight among the fans over drawing graffiti

column3: When drunk fans (angry because Zrninjski lost the game) don't verbally assault women wearing Velež jearsy

column3: When Bosniaks and Croats living close to one another get along well

column3: When the people in my surrounding are from all religions

column2: Kada u naselju nema huligana
column3: When there aren't any hooligans in the neighbourhoods

column2: Komšija je vrijedniji nego rođeni brat, jer može odmah doći u slučaju potrebe.
column3: A neighbour is worth more than one's own brother, because they can always come in the time of need

column3: Neighbors in Podhum socialize at one another's homes.

column2: Komšije/susjedi se u Podhumu druže kao prije rata.
column3: Neighbours still socialize in Podhum as before the war

column3: The criminals are the ones who cause the problems and not the majority

column2: Ljude koji imaju dovoljne plate ne zanimaju Dodik, Čović i Izetbegović
column3: People who earn enough are not interested in Dodik, Čović and Izetbegović

column2: Ljudi imaju platu od koje se može živjeti.
column3: People have a salary from which they can live.

column2: Ljudi koji su došli sa strane ne govore ružno o Mostaru
column3: People who come from outside don't speak ill about Mostar

column2: Ljudi koji u Mostaru zagovaraju sukobe su sankcionisani.
column3: People who advocate for conflicts in Mostar are sanctioned

column2: Ljudi mirno hodaju i po lijevoj i po desnoj strani grada.
column3: People walk peacefully on both the left and the right side of the city.

column2: Ljudi različitih vjera su naučili živjeti zajedno u Mostaru
column3: People of different religions learned how to live together in Mostar

column2: Ljudi se ne boje da će se opet desiti rat.
column3: People are not afraid that the war could happen again

column2: Ljudi se osjećaju sigurno u ulici fra Ambre Miletića, jer nema kriminala.
column3: People feel safe in Fra Ambro Miletić street because there are no criminals.

column2: Ljudi u Mostaru idu na posao i vraćaju se s njega, a niko ih ne dira, niti oni nekoga diraju.
column3: In Mostar, people go to work and back without being bothered or bothering anyone

column2: Ljudi u Mostaru ne govore „istočna i zapadna strana“.
column3: People in Mostar don't use the terms "east side" and "west side"

column3: People in Mostar don't talk about the war, but rather where to spend their holidays

column2: Ljudi u Mostaru su stekli povjerenje u sistem, jer on nije korumpiran.
column3: People in Mostar have gained trust in the system, since it is not corrupted

column2: Ljudi u Mostaru žive od svog rada.
column3: People in Mostar can live from their work.

column2: Ljudi u Podhumu se osjećaju sigurnije, jer je policija redovno prisutna.
column3: People of Podhum feel safe because police patrols regularly

column3: People in Podhum live from renting rooms to tourists

column3: Nobody breaks the windows of Podhum's tenants living in houses

column3: People who have moved to Podhum after the war are not insulting girls passing cafe Dario based on their nationality

column3: Locals, who have lived in Podhum since before the war, do not insult girls on national grounds who pass by cafe Dario.

column2: Multireligioznost je bogatsvo Mostara.*
column3: Multi-religiousness is Mostar's richness.

column2: Muškarac ne pljačka kladionicu za 70 KM
column3: A man does not rob a betting shop for 70 BAM

column2: Muslimanima dolaze katolici i pravoslavci na Bajram.
column3: Orthodox and Catholics visit Muslims on Eid

column3: There are plenty of activities for children at SC Kantarevac (not only concerts and the Christmas tournament)

column3: More children and elderly go out to the promenade and Spanish square

column3: There are 50% of Bosniak and 50% of Croat students studying tourism at Džemal Bijedić University of Mostar

column3: Parents spend time together by the seats at the playground in Podhum while they wait for their children

column3: There are no discarded drug syringes on the streets of Podhum

column3: The national representatives of all three nations are interested in ordinary people, and not only in how to distribute functions and money.

column3: A person going to school on the west side of Mostar can go to a university on the east side and vice versa

column3: Parks between the buildings in Podhum are not turned into parking lots

column3: Police come to Podhum at the call of citizens when an act is committed

column2: U Mostaru nema ljudi, kojima smetaju ljudi drugačiji svjetonazora.

column3: Not all associations in Mostar are mono-ethnic.

column3: Neighbors in Podhum help each other regardless of their nationality

column3: Students are not taught to differentiate people based on their names (Kristina, Bojana or Emina)

column3: The streets are well-lit in Podhum, so a father doesn't need to go to pick up his daughter at 18:15 from neighbouring Šemovac in order to bring her home to Podhum.

column2: Ulice u Podhumu su osvijetljene pa se ljudi osjećaju sigurno kad hodaju navečer.

column2: Velež i Zrinjski nisu vezani za nacionalni ili religijski identitet
column3: Velež and Zrinjski are not tied to any national or religious identity.
